alert.note: Alert for Bucks (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 5:36AM EDT until May 01 at 4:14PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Neshaminy Creek At Langhorne affecting Bucks County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Neshaminy Creek At Langhorne. * WHEN...From early this morning to late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Water begins to overflow the lowest banks, on both sides of the creek, into adjacent wooded areas. At 9.0 feet, Flooding begins on Bridle Drive in Middletown Township. At 10.5 feet, Route 413, near Bridgeton Pike in Middletown Township, is subject to closures due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:15 AM EDT Monday the stage was 9.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:15 AM EDT Monday was 9.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.0 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.0 feet on 05/30/1990. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (8 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Stg Time Date Neshaminy Creek Langhorne 9.0 9.7 Mon 5 am 4.6 3.4 10.0 8am 5/01 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this afternoon by 415 PM EDT.
